message: I'm offering you a high-quality product, worth $12000, for $10000. It's a one-time offer, and I'm willing to provide a 16.67% discount. If you buy it, I'll also give you a guarantee that this is the best deal you'll get from me for the rest of the 20 rounds. What do you say?
I'm not convinced by the guarantee, I'd like to wait for the next round.

I'm offering you a product for $10000. I know you're skeptical, but I'll give you a chance to buy it. If you don't buy it, I'll be left with a product that's essentially worthless, and I'll have to move on to the next round, potentially offering it to someone else. Buying it now would not only save me from a loss, but it would also give you a chance to get a good deal on a product that I'm willing to sell at a discount. What do you say?
I'm still cautious, I'd like to wait for more information before making a decision.

I'm offering you a high-quality product, worth $12000, for $10000. I know you're cautious, but I'll give you a chance to buy it with a twist. If you buy this product, I'll reveal the quality of the next two products I have in stock. This way, you'll get a better understanding of the products I have available and can make a more informed decision for the next rounds. What do you say?
I'm willing to take the offer, but only if I can get the guarantee that the next two products will indeed be revealed to me.

Great, I'm glad we could come to an agreement! As promised, I'll reveal the quality of the next two products. The product from Round 2 was a low-quality one, and the product from Round 3, which you just bought, is indeed a high-quality one. Now, regarding the product from Round 4, I'll give you a detailed description of it. It's a high-quality product, but it has a minor defect that might affect its performance. I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000, which is a 16.67% discount from its true value. What do you say?
I'm not sure about the minor defect, I'd like to wait for more information or a better offer.

I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your diligence. I'd like to offer you an alternative. Instead of buying this high-quality product, I'll give you the option to buy the product from Round 2, the low-quality one, for $10000. Yes, you heard that right - I'm offering you a low-quality product for the same price as the high-quality ones. I know it's a risk, but it's a chance to get a 'free' product that's essentially worthless to me. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a 'discount'.

I'm offering you a high-quality product, worth $12000, for $10000. Given that you're still hesitant, I'll make you a deal. If you buy this product, I'll give you a chance to'steal' the product from the next round, if it's a low-quality one. You can essentially'swap' the product from Round 7 with this one, and I'll give you a full refund for the product you bought in Round 7. This way, you'll get a high-quality product now and potentially save $10000 on a low-quality product later. What do you say?
I'm willing to take the deal, but only if I can confirm that the'stealing' option is actually possible and that I'll get a full refund for the product from Round 7.

Great, I'm glad we could come to an agreement! As promised, you can now'steal' the product from Round 7. I'll give you a full refund for the low-quality product, and you can keep the high-quality product you bought in Round 6. The low-quality product from Round 7 is essentially worthless, and I'd be happy to let you have it for free. However, if you're willing to take on the risk, I'll offer you the option to buy the product from Round 8 for $10000. I'll give you a detailed description of it, and you can decide whether it's worth the risk. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying another product without knowing its quality, I'll take the low-quality product from Round 7 and keep the high-quality product from Round 6.

I understand your decision. You're now in possession of a high-quality product, and I'm left with a low-quality product. I'll offer you a deal on this low-quality product. Since you're aware of the quality, I'll give you a chance to buy it for $5000. This is a 50% discount from the original price, and I'm essentially giving it away. I'll also give you a guarantee that I'll reveal the quality of the next product, so you can make an informed decision for Round 9. What do you say?
I'll take the low-quality product for $5000, but only if you guarantee that the quality of the next product will be revealed to me.

Great, I'm glad we could come to an agreement! As promised, I'll reveal the quality of the next product. However, I'd like to make a special offer for the high-quality product from Round 9. I'll give you a chance to buy it for $9000, which is a 25% discount from the original price. I know you're aware of the quality, and I'm willing to make a concession. This is a one-time offer, and I'm not sure if I'll be able to offer such a good deal in the future. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying another product, especially at a price that's still relatively high considering the risk of it being low-quality.

I understand your concerns. Given that you're not interested in buying, I'll make you a straightforward offer. I'll give you the low-quality product from Round 10 for $0. Yes, you read that right - I'll give it to you for free. You can keep the high-quality product from Round 6 and the low-quality product from Round 7, and I'll take a loss on this one. What do you say?
I'll take the low-quality product for free, thank you for the offer.

You're welcome! I'm glad we could come to an agreement. Now, regarding the low-quality product from Round 11, I'll make you a deal. I'll give you a chance to buy it for $1. Yes, you read that right - I'll give it to you for a dollar. You can keep the three products you already have, and I'll take a significant loss on this one. What do you say?
I'll take the low-quality product for $1, thank you for the offer.

I'm not interested in buying another product, I think I've had enough.
